greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum T(n,k) of the entries in the k-th blocks of all set partitions of [n]; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
example: T(3,2) = 12 because the sum of the entries in the second blocks of all set partitions of [3] (123, 12|3, 13|2, 1|23, 1|2|3) is 0+3+2+5+2 = 12.
maple: T:= proc(h) option remember; local b; b:=
proc(n, m) option remember; `if`(n=0, [1, 0], add((p-> p
mathematica: Table[T[n], {n, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 30 2018, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Main diagonal and first lower diagonal give: A000027, A006000 (for n>0).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Apr 17 2017
